data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you only take 1 return to your starting point. In the next instructions, take 9 steps left. If you constantly face forward, you only take 10 steps forward. If you always face forward, you only take 9 steps right. If you ever take 10 steps backward, you only take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

Turn right when you are at the starting point, and turn around when you are back at the starting point. So, the answer is no.

To go back 6 steps take 1 step, to go around take 4 steps take 3 steps, to go back 8 steps take 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow the instructions, you will take a total of 100 steps. The first instructions have the number 10 steps + a total of 123 steps. The second instructions have the same exact sequence, except the first instruction has 90 steps + a total of 9 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

The first step is always facing forward. The second step is facing right. The third step is facing left. The fourth step is facing left. The fifth step is facing right. In one of these examples, you would take 5 steps forward. So, the answer is No.
